attributes.action: Challenge Theresa May to spend a week shadowing staff working in a busy A&E .
attributes.additional_details: There clearly is a 'magic money tree'. On the 4/1/17 an estimated 17,000 patients were stuck in ambulances waiting for beds to become free. There simply isn't the beds or the staff to manage the high number of patients needing care. On 7/1/18 Theresa May stated that the NHS was never 'better prepared' for winter. Mrs May is incongruent in her beliefs. Doctors, nurses, patients and carers cannot be more vociferous. What else needs to happen for her to accept the reality?
attributes.background: On 3/6/2017 When asked about NHS funding being increased. Theresa May told a question time audience, 'we will put more money into the NHS, but there is not a magic money tree'. On the 26/6/17 Theresa May found a billion pound to prop up her minority government after her disastrous election result.

rejection.details: This would be a personal decision for the Prime Minister, not the responsibility of the UK Government and Parliament as a whole.
